meanings.definition: In a state of decay or decomposition, especially of organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The putrid smell of the garbage made me cover my nose.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen was filled with a putrid stench from the rotting food.
meanings.sent3: The putrid odor coming from the fridge was so bad, it could make a skunk faint.
meanings.sent4: The putrid air in the swamp was thick with the scent of decaying plants.
meanings.sent5: The putrid liquid oozing from the trash bag was a sight no one wanted to see.

meanings.sent1: The putrid taste of the medicine made the child gag.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had a putrid atmosphere that sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent3: The putrid color combination of the outfit made everyone at the party cringe.
meanings.sent4: The putrid behavior of the bully made him unpopular among his classmates.
meanings.sent5: The putrid sight of the overflowing dumpster was enough to make anyone lose their appetite.
